name: 2018/11/07 Lunch Steak
description: This high-protein, low-carb, low-sodium, and low-sugar lunch steak recipe is a perfect example of a healthified meal that doesn't compromise on flavor. Ideal for those following a healthy diet, this recipe brings out the best in quality porterhouse steak paired with tender asparagus, seasoned perfectly with a hint of pepper and the aromatic presence of garlic and sesame seeds. A must-try for health enthusiasts!
recipeIngredient: 1  tsp(s) Seeds, sesame seeds, whole, dried

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat your grill or pan over high heat.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 1

recipeInstructions.text: Trim the asparagus and, if desired, peel the lower stalks for more uniform cooking.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 2

recipeInstructions.text: Crush the garlic and mix with sesame seeds in a small bowl.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 3

recipeInstructions.text: Rub the porterhouse steak with the garlic and sesame seed mixture, then season with ground pepper.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 4

recipeInstructions.text: Place the steak on the grill or pan, let it cook for about 5 minutes per side for medium-rare, or adjust time based on desired doneness. (Cooking time: PT10M)
recipeInstructions.name: Step 5

recipeInstructions.text: While steak is cooking, steam or grill the asparagus until tender but still crisp, which should take about 3-4 minutes. (Cooking time: PT4M)
recipeInstructions.name: Step 6

recipeInstructions.text: Let the steak rest for 5 minutes after cooking to redistribute juices.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 7

recipeInstructions.text: Serve the steak alongside or topped with the asparagus.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 8
